en.cameraPerm: We need your permission to show the camera
en.addToMyLuresFail: Something went wrong please try again
en.earlyLate: Between sunrise and 12PM. Between 4PM to sunset
en.noStructure: Input one of our available structures
en.structureInput: The structure you will be fishing
en.noLures: We current do not have the lure you are trying to find. Please click cancel and request it so one of our guides can get the information on it.
en.noUserLures: You do not have any lures.
en.requestFailed: Your request for this lure has failed, please try again
en.requestSucceed: Your request has been recieved, we will contact you within 24 business hours
en.dateExceeds8Days: *Cannot get weather for dates more that 8 days from now*
en.tutSetLocation: Select the location that you will be fishing
en.tutSetTemperature: Select the water temperature that you will be fishing. This will determine the depth you will be fishing.
en.tutSetSpecies: Select the fish species you will be targeting
en.tutSetDate: Select the date and then time you will be fishing. This will be used to get the weather.
en.tutSetWater: Click the image that is closest to the clarity of the water you will be fishing
en.tutConditionsSubmit: Once you are sure of all of the information click submit to find the best lures for these conditions
en.tutBrandOrModel: Tap to select the brand or model you want the information on
en.tutOptions: Type the brand or name of a lure and then select it from the dropdown. If you cannot find it go back to request it.
en.tutSelectOptions: Select the lure with the options you want details on
en.tutOptionDetails: View the lures colors, size and weight here
en.tutRequestNewLure: If you dont see the lure you've searched for request it here
en.tutAddToLures: Tap here to save the lure to your lure list.
en.tutSubmit: Once your lure is selected and has a green background click here to get the best conditions to use it in
en.tutStructure: Select the physical feature or formation of the spot you will fish. This can be found in a navigation chart
en.tutGuide: The guide that has provided the information
en.tutMoonPhase: Providing you information on the next and previous moon phase. These phases can affect fishing productivity
en.tutPreviousWeather: Providing you information on the previous day's weather. This weather can affect fishing productivity
en.tutColors: The first and second color most visible on the lure
en.tutSize: The size of the lure in inches
en.tutWeight: The weight of the lure in ounces
en.tutPrice: The price in CAD of the lure at our selected store
en.tutLureStore: Enter the name of the store your lure can be found at
en.tutLureBrand: Enter the name of the brand of your lure
en.tutLureWeight: Enter the lure's length weight (in ounces)
en.tutLureType: Make sure to select the type of lure you're requestion
en.tutLurePhoto: Lastly, submit a photo of the lure you want to request
en.tutLureSubmit: Once all required details are provided, click here to request the lure.
en.tutLureSearch: Type in this textbox to find the lure you want.
en.fishFullFromFeedingMoon: Yesterday's moon cycle made the fish active and they may be full from it.
en.rainedFishFed: It rained yesterday! Fish have likely fed because when it rains, the insect fall off the trees and it will trigger a feeding frenzy!
en.noPrecipitationsFishHungry: It did not rain yesterday, they will be more active.
en.windYesterdayWaterDirty: There was wind yesterday. The water has been rotated and may be dirtier than normal
en.nextMoonPhaseFishActive: Next Moon Phase: Fish might be more active.
en.nextMoonPhaseFishLessActive: Next Moon Phase: Fish might be less active.
en.luresRecommendedByLucas: Lures recommended by expert Lucas Deschenes:
en.noLureForConditions: We currently do not have the data for the criteria entered, please try different conditions.
en.moonCycleInfo: Moon cycles affect fishing quality more than one would expect.
en.weatherInfo: The weather has multiple effects on the quality of your fishing.
en.infoTides: The gravitational pull of the moon affects the ocean tides, which can increase water movement and stimulate fish activity/feeding.
en.infoLightLevels: Moonlight varies with the moon phases. Moonlight increases fish activity due to better visibility, while the low light during a new moon decreases it.
en.infoFeedingPatterns: Some fish prefer to feed during a full moon due to visibility; others prefer to use the dark of the new moon to hunt.
en.infoBioRhythms: Fish and other marine life have biological rhythms influenced by the lunar cycle. These can affect spawning, migration, and feeding behaviours.
en.infoTemperature: Fish are cold-blooded and their activity levels are influenced by water temperature. Warmer means increased metabolism; colder means reduced activity.
en.infoPressure: Approaching storms often bring low air pressure, which can make fish more active. Rising air pressure, usually after a storm, can make fish lethargic and less likely to bite.
en.infoWind: Wind can oxygenate the water surface, pushing food sources (plankton, insects) towards the shore and attracting the fish. However, strong winds aren't exactly fun to fish in.
en.infoRain: Light rain can increase oxygen levels in the water and wash insects into the water. Heavy rain can disrupt the water clarity and temperature.
en.windInfo: Here's how wind speeds can affect your fishing experience.
en.infoWaterMove: Moderate wind stirs up the water surface, increasing oxygen levels and pushing food sources like insects and plankton towards the shore, attracting fish.
en.infoFishActivity: Wind can make fish more active and willing to feed, especially near windward shores where food is concentrated.
en.infoWaterClarity: Strong winds can churn up sediment, reducing water clarity. This can make fish more cautious and affect their feeding behavior.
en.infoChallenges: High winds can make boat control difficult, casting less precise, and overall fishing conditions more challenging and uncomfortable.
